title: Blended Learning Quality Evaluation: Project-Based Approach Through Organizational Behavior Case Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic organizational behavior theory and lifelong learning experience
context.additional_context: A non-degree social sciences program operating in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, where learners participate concurrently in online/offline activities using personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can design a blended learning quality evaluation system utilizing the four CIPP evaluation components (context, input, process, product).
Learners can hierarchize quality indicators and perform weighted analysis for blended learning courses in organizational behavior using the AHP technique.
Learners can diagnose learner-instructor interaction issues and propose improvement strategies through project-based assessment.

resources: Blended Learning Case Database (Organizational Behavior Field)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
